sentence.Network_en: They have been galvanised into collective action — militarily, politically and economically.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在形势驱使下已经在政治、经济和军事上采取了联合行动。

sentence.Network_en: The country's politicians are already heaving a collective sigh of relief.
sentence.Network_cn: 该国的政界人士均已松了口气。

sentence.Network_en: Social science is a collective name, covering a series of individual sciences.
sentence.Network_cn: 社会科学是一个统称，涵盖一系列的独立学科。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'representing many individuals'): from Old French collectif, -ive or Latin collectivus, from collect- 'gathered together', from the verb colligere (see collect)

entry.def: Collective actions, situations, or feelings involve or are shared by every member of a group of people.

example.ex: The country's politicians are already heaving a collective sigh of relief.
example.tran: 该国的政界人士均已松了口气。

entry.def: A collective amount of something is the total obtained by adding together the amounts that each person or thing in a group has.

example.ex: Their collective volume wasn't very large.

entry.def: The collective term for two or more types of thing is a general word or expression which refers to all of them.

example.ex: Social science is a collective name, covering a series of individual sciences.
example.tran: 社会科学是一个统称，涵盖一系列的独立学科。

entry.def: A collective is a business or farm which is run, and often owned, by a group of people who take an equal share of any profits.

example.ex: He will see that he is participating in all the decisions of the collective.
example.tran: 他会确保自己参与集体企业的各项决策。

means.word_mean: 1. done by or characteristic of individuals acting together;
3. set up on the principle of collectivism or ownership and production by the workers involved usually under the supervision of a government;

Sentence.sentence: To classify parenting as a personal choice for which there is no collective responsibility is not merely to ignore the social benefits of good parenting; really, it is to steal those benefits because they accrue (不断积累) to the whole of society as today's children become tomorrow's productive citizenry (公民).

means.word_mean: 集体的, 共同的, 共有的

sentences.en: We all bear collective responsibility for this decision.
sentences.cn: 我们大家共同承担这项决定的责任。

jushi.english: This success was the result of a collective effort.
jushi.chinese: 这次成功是全体努力的结果。

jushi.english: We all bear collective responsibility for this decision.
jushi.chinese: 我们大家共同承担这项决定的责任。
